item.description:

None the less there was much copy pasta for this dance track

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Ye. I’ve deleted most of them in time. I kept up one of them because sometimes I listen to a playlist of my crap when I’m trying to sleep. Haha.

I renamed most of my Auxy Tournament stuff to [Shorts] since I didn’t want to delete them, but the longer 3 min entry was eventually renamed completely. Some of my favourite work!

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Tbh I just want to keep the SC tidy, but I’ll probs just leave it as a project link since if it’s not considered my own work and not considered collaborative, rather as a challenge. I shouldn’t post it as such on the SC since as I said above, I’d prefer a more polished to and fro collab on my SC.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
I understand you want customisation within your title. But it’s a challenge to make a song using what’s provided. Your name is the only thing relevant. Yeah, it’d be cool to have some background meaning for it, but it’s not really “your” own piece of work. It’s a challenge. And I’m sorry if it annoys you but that’s the way it’s been set

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
Yeah, I mean all I’m asking is for it to be easily recognised as my own challenge just as btc was. It wasn’t recquired to change the title in btc. It’s not really a “strict” rule. I mean it already comes with the title. All u need to add is your name.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
When someone invests their time and energy to arrange a competition to entertain us all, they can set their own rules. …providing they don’t clash with the forum rules.

They could ask for the file to be named GoatCheese32_[user name] if they want. eg: perhaps they’re a massive goat’s feta cheese fan.

That happens.

In this case, DJLR probably wants to promote his “Viewer’s Edits” challenges, which is fair enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
I’ll also add that a lot of people have different preferences for how their titles are formatted. Flexibility in this area will also help people keep their song titles consistent and neat throughout their SC.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Titling a work is like the cherry on top for a couple hours of effort, so you’ll find people get defensive about having strict title outlines when it’s their little reward at the end. Even in the BTC I have something like:

Auxy • Beat The Clock #25 • You’ll Never Feel The Same

It’s long as hell but falls within comp guidelines and allows me to title. In my experience, the only times you should care about strict guidelines is where the additional flair of authorship will affect judging. Keep it fun where possible, imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
Yeah, but why is that a rule? Just seems like a strict and random rule for no reason to enforce.

Read full topic

item.title: Viewers Edits #2
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
Well that’s the way I’ve set the rules in BTC the title was always the same except with a different number. However for this challenge all u do is add your name in the project. And when u post on soundcloud u can title it “DJLR - Viewers Edits #2” or u could just leave the title

Read full topic
